bibl.title: Letter from F.B. Kain to Laura Armistead Carter, December 11, 1931

div1.p: Kain sends Laura Carter the biography of Henry Rose Carter as it will appear in the National Cyclopedia of Biography and asks her to consider a portrait with the entry, for a fee. He includes a description of the National Cyclopedia.

div1.head: Letter from F.B. Kain to Laura Armistead Carter, December 11, 1931
div1.opener:
IN REPLY REFER TO
EDITORIAL DEPARTMENT
THE NATIONAL CYCLOPEDIA OF AMERICAN BIOGRAPHY
THE FOREMOST BIOGRAPHICAL AUTHORITY OF THE UNITED STATES
70 FIFTH AVENUE, NEW YORK
December 11, 1931.
JAMES T. WHITE & CO.
PUBLISHERS
(Founded in 1873)
CABLE ADDRESS: JOIST, N.Y.
TELEPHONES {ALGONQUIN 7390
{ALGONQUIN 7391
Miss Laura A. Carter,
2030 Highland Ave.,
Birmingham, Ala.
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
The enclosed biography of your father has been prepared for
THE NATIONAL CYCLOPEDIA OF AMERICAN BIOGRAPHY. Will you kindly go over
the proof carefully, noting such corrections and additions as will make
it accurate and complete, and return it at your earliest convenience.
At the same time I ask your consideration of the portrait feature.

The NATIONAL CYCLOPEDIA is a historical and permanent work of
reference, whose object is to preserve the records of prominent Americans
in every line of activity and sphere of influence for the future student
and historian. It holds a high place in American literature and the
published volumes are to be found in the leading libraries and educational
institutions of your state as well as in every other state of the Union.

You can readily appreciate that a monumental work of this character
could hardly be published without some financial cooperation, as the very
nature of the work precludes the possibility of a great popular sale. It
is distinctly a reference work, its circulation being necessarily limited
to the larger reference libraries. Hence, the Publishers have found it
necessary to make a charge for Portrait illustrations.

The American public have been most generous in their support of
this feature of the work and the published volumes are already recognized
as the NATIONAL PORTRAIT GALLERY, and the greatest collection of authentic
portraits of prominent persons ever published. A portrait contributes so
much to the character and interpretation of a biography that we trust you
will decide to cooperate with us in giving the same distinction to your
father's biography that characterizes the others in the Cyclopedia. In
asking your consideration of this feature I call your attention to the
enclosed booklet, “The Portrait Indispensable.” The cost of portrait
reproduction varies with the style chosen. We shall be glad to submit
samples and prices on request.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, F. B. KAIN
Associate Editor FBK/LM
